abstract: NSMetadataQueryResultContentRelevanceAttribute Global VariableNSMetadataQueryResultContentRelevanceAttributeiOS 5.0+iPadOS 5.0+Mac Catalyst 13.1+macOS 10.4+tvOS 9.0+visionOS 1.0+watchOS 2.0+let NSMetadataQueryResultContentRelevanceAttribute: StringDiscussionThe key used to retrieve an NSNumber object with a floating point value between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive. The relevance value indicates the relevance of the content of a result object. The relevance is computed based on the value of the result itself, not on its relevance to the other results returned by the query. If the value is not computed, it is treated as an attribute on the item that does not exist.

# NSMetadataQueryResultContentRelevanceAttribute | Apple Developer Documentation

- [ Foundation ](/documentation/foundation)

- [ NSMetadataQueryResultContentRelevanceAttribute ](/documentation/Foundation/NSMetadataQueryResultContentRelevanceAttribute)

-  NSMetadataQueryResultContentRelevanceAttribute 

Global Variable# NSMetadataQueryResultContentRelevanceAttribute

iOS 5.0+iPadOS 5.0+Mac Catalyst 13.1+macOS 10.4+tvOS 9.0+visionOS 1.0+watchOS 2.0+

```
let NSMetadataQueryResultContentRelevanceAttribute: String
```

## [Discussion](/documentation/Foundation/NSMetadataQueryResultContentRelevanceAttribute#Discussion)

The key used to retrieve an `NSNumber` object with a floating point value between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive. The relevance value indicates the relevance of the content of a result object. The relevance is computed based on the value of the result itself, not on its relevance to the other results returned by the query. If the value is not computed, it is treated as an attribute on the item that does not exist.
title: NSMetadataQueryResultContentRelevanceAttribute | Apple Developer Documentation
